wikipedia_page.main: Charles Allen (31 May 1878 – 22 May 1958) was an English first-class cricketer who played for Gloucestershire County Cricket Club in two matches in 1909. He was born and died in Cirencester.

response: *Charles Allen (Massachusetts politician) (1797–1869), American politician and Congressman in Massachusetts
*Charles Allen (RAF officer) (1899–1974), British World War I flying ace
*Charles Allen (D.C. politician), American politician and member of the Council of the District of Columbia
*Charles Allen, Baron Allen of Kensington (born 1957), English businessman
*Charles Allen (Australian politician) (1833–1913), member of the Tasmanian House of Assembly
*Charles Allen (Stroud MP) (1861–1930), English Liberal politician who represented Stroud, 1900–1914
